text: Hi all, I'm having an issue with Hubl local server. Our main JS file isn't being served fully, content ends at 12kb of a 280kb file. Does anyone know a solution to this?
that’s a lot of JS! Your best route is to contact support. It helps if you have a reproducible test case
<@U22PJPGK0> It's a concatenated file of all the site JS, we're working towards a leaner requireJS type system but at the moment this seems the best way. Just seems weird it doesn't serve it all!
I've just tested a few different JS files and it cuts them off at random places, I'm guessing it may be to do with EOF chars or something.
I'm having problems when uploading files to ftp at the moment
<@U25PYL3Q8|nickdeckerdevs> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/nickdeckerdevs/F44M7RDSP/gulp_ftp_upload_error_event_js_160.js|gulp ftp upload error event.js:160>

hello all - i’m having a client issue about utm/original source attribution…can someone please help?  here’s the situation - the client website is on HubSpot cos.  there’s a HubSpot CTA button on the home page that takes the  visitor to an app sign up page (on <http://app.company.com|app.company.com>).  when a visitor signs up on the sign up page in a non-HubSpot form, the visitor info is passed on to HubSpot form via HubSpot form api and reading the hs cookie.  in HubSpot the new contact info becomes available but all traffic is showing up as DIRECT TRAFFIC for original source field instead of the correct source attribution.
we are running paid search campaigns that bring new sign ups but their attribution is all showing up as DIRECT TRAFFIC in husbpot contact original source field.

<@U3CKY9VPY> We've have similar issues and in the past HubSpot support has indicated that unless it's a HubSpot form, you won't be able to get traffic information other than direct traffic. As such, we ended up transitioning all our forms to HubSpot forms. Probably doesn't help but that's what we've learned. Maybe someone else knows a better way.
one of the developers here gave me the code for reading the hs cookie and passing the values as params into the form api call.
i can’t really make the app sign up form a HubSpot form. that’s the challenge here.  it collects passwords, etc

<@U3CKY9VPY> submitting a HubSpot form at the same time of your app form might be a solution. That way you get the data you need in your form and submit the data that HubSpot needs independently. You could switch out the submit button, or add a jquery event that submits the other form in a hidden div.
